conclusion: To find the magnitude of the voltage U across MN and the direction of the induced current flowing through the fixed resistor R, we need to consider the following steps.
The magnetic force on the conductor MN is F = BIL = BIL.
The voltage U across the resistor R is U = IR = BIL/R.
The direction of the induced current is given by the right-hand rule.
The induced current is I = BL/R.
The magnitude of the voltage U across MN is BIL/R and the direction of the induced current flowing through the fixed resistor R is in the direction of the magnetic field.
